lib
Interface Text

All Known Implementing Classes:
TextChunk, TextGlyph
public interface Text

Text is an interface that represents a block of text, possibly with multiple lines, possibly colorized or possibly mixed with or replaced by arbitrary artwork drawn with the Drawable interface. This is used primarily in drawing game logs, either by creating the log strings using TextChunk and TextGlyph, or by creating the log strings normally and colorizing them using the colorize(lib.InternationalStrings, lib.Text...) interface.

Author:
Ddyer

colorize

void colorize(InternationalStrings s,
              Text... coloredChunks)
colorize this chunk, replacing words with translated colored words. The matched words will be separated from the rest of the text by non-letter non-digit characters, so "brown" will not match "brownie" in the text. Normally, the text will be already translated, and the translations should be supplied to the colorized words will be matched against their translated equivalents.

Parameters:
s - the current translations
coloredChunks - the untranslated list of words to color

getColor

java.awt.Color getColor()
get the color associated with this chunk, which may be null

Returns:
the color of the text

getString

java.lang.String getString()
get the text associated with this chunk. For complex chunks that have been joined or colorized, this is the text for the entire collection.

Returns:
a string representation of the text

selectFontSize

java.awt.Font selectFontSize(java.awt.Graphics inG,
                             int inWidth,
                             int inHeight)
set inG to a suitable font size to print inStr in a specified box size. This is the underlying font sizing algorithm used by G.Text(java.awt.Graphics, boolean, java.awt.Rectangle, java.awt.Color, java.awt.Color, java.lang.String) if inWidth < 0, no fitting is done and the current font size of not changed.

Parameters:
inG -
inWidth -
inHeight -
Returns:
the original inG font

draw

int draw(java.awt.Graphics inG,
         boolean center,
         int inX,
         int inY,
         int inWidth,
         int inHeight,
         java.awt.Color fgColour,
         java.awt.Color bgColor)
draw the colorized text string, resized downward if necessary to fit the box. The chunk may be composed of multiple lines that were split, and multiple chunks that were colorized. if width<0, center the text at xpos without resizing if height=0, center the text at ypos

Parameters:
inG - the graphics to draw
rotation - TODO
center - if true, center the text
inX - x location of the left edge
inY - y location of the upper-left corner
inWidth - box width
inHeight - box height
fgColour - foreground color (or null)
bgColor - background color (or null)
Returns:
the text width

drawRight

int drawRight(java.awt.Graphics inG,
              int inX,
              int inY,
              int inWidth,
              int inHeight,
              java.awt.Color fgColour,
              java.awt.Color bgColor)
draw the colorized text string, right justified, resized downward if necessary to fit the box. The chunk may be composed of multiple lines that were split, and multiple chunks that were colorized. if width<0, center the text at xpos without resizing if height=0, center the text at ypos

Parameters:
inG - the graphics to draw
center - if true, center the text
inX - x location of the left edge
inY - y location of the upper-left corner
inWidth - box width
inHeight - box height
fgColour - foreground color (or null)
bgColor - background color (or null)
Returns:
the text width
